programme.title: Earths Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Documentary profiling some of the worlds most expansive - and inhospitable - landscapes, and the people who live there. A fisherman in Zambia faces off against crocodiles and risks being swept to his death as he tries to make a living above the imposing Victoria Falls, and in the Amazon, a giant fish offers salvation to a hungry family that calls the river home. A boys future hangs on the outcome of a single horse race in the vast grasslands of the Steppe, and in a European salt marsh, a young man duels with a savage bull in a centuries-old battle of wills

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Barbara is persuaded to speak to a womens group about her self-sufficient lifestyle - and soon finds herself in great demand. Vintage comedy, with Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal, featuring guest appearances by Robert Lindsay and Angela Thorne

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Sir Humphrey is horrified when Jim decides to support the sale of an art gallery to save the football club in his constituency from going under. Comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Revisiting the African lions that learned to prey on elephants in the drought-ridden Kalahari Desert, and catching up with the pride during the rainy season. Imogen Stubbs narrates

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Writer and comedian Michael Palin takes a train ride from Derry to Kerry, trying to dispel a few myths about Irish rail travel and learn about the emigrants who left for America during the famines of the 1840s. He climbs aboard the so-called peace train, operated jointly by Northern Ireland Railways and Irish Rail, a service which has come to symbolise cross-border co-operation

programme.title: Michael Palin: The Art of Travel
programme.desc: The actor looks back at a century-old rail service to St Andrews, where the LNERs publicity department of the 1920s and 1930s promoted an industrial service alongside familiar holiday resorts. From 1989

programme.title: Comic Roots
programme.desc: A 1983 documentary in which the actor discusses his early interest in acting and comedy, reflecting on his education at the Shrewsbury School and Oxford University. First broadcast 12 August 1983

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Detailed account of the bloody uprising at a New York State prison in 1971. Over 1,000 inmates took control of Attica Correctional Facility, seizing 39 hostages in the process. Their demands related mainly to the inhumane conditions they were forced to endure, but a huge police assault and a hail of gunfire killed 29 convicts and 10 innocents, an action that has left many survivors, both guards and inmates, seeking compensation

programme.title: Dan Cruickshank and the Family That Built Gothic Britain
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the changing fortunes of a family of architects, following the rise and fall of George Gilbert Scott, his son George Junior, and grandson Giles. Presenter Dan Cruickshank finds out how the dynasty was responsible for the creation of iconic landmarks such as the Midland Hotel at St Pancras station, and helped shape the Victorian age with their designs

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Writer and comedian Michael Palin takes a train ride from Derry to Kerry, trying to dispel a few myths about Irish rail travel and learn about the emigrants who left for America during the famines of the 1840s. He climbs aboard the so-called peace train, operated jointly by Northern Ireland Railways and Irish Rail, a service which has come to symbolise cross-border co-operation

programme.title: Earths Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Documentary profiling some of the worlds most expansive - and inhospitable - landscapes, and the people who live there. A fisherman in Zambia faces off against crocodiles and risks being swept to his death as he tries to make a living above the imposing Victoria Falls, and in the Amazon, a giant fish offers salvation to a hungry family that calls the river home. A boys future hangs on the outcome of a single horse race in the vast grasslands of the Steppe, and in a European salt marsh, a young man duels with a savage bull in a centuries-old battle of wills

programme.title: Tornado: The 100mph Steam Engine
programme.desc: Cameras follow a secret overnight attempt to set a 100 mph ecord for the newly-built steam locomotive Tornado, between Newcastle and York on the East Coast Main Line

programme.title: The Return of Flying Scotsman
programme.desc: Cameras follow one of the worlds most famous locomotives as it returns to the tracks following a 10-year restoration that cost more than £4 million. Enthusiasts and supporters are aboard as the train sets off from Londons Kings Cross Station on a journey to York and its new home at the National Railway Museum. John Shrapnel narrates

programme.title: Flying Scotsman from the Footplate
programme.desc: A guide to life on the footplate of the nations favourite steam engine. Cameras are placed aboad locomotive 60103 as it travels along the Severn Valley, cutting through stunning landscapes on a journey from Bridgnorth to Kidderminster. The cab cameras capture veteran driver Roger Norfolk and fireman Ryan Green in action as they talk through the mechanics and challenges of operating this national treasure. Needless to say, things sometimes get hot on the footplate and not everything goes exactly to plan

programme.title: Ian Hislop Goes Off the Rails
programme.desc: The story behind the 1963 Beeching Report, commissioned under Harold Macmillans government, which led to the closure of a third of Britains rail network. With contributions from experts, campaigners, railwaymen and passengers, Private Eye editor Ian Hislop outlines the historical background to the proposals, along with the social and economic impact that followed their implementation

programme.title: Waris Hussein Remembers - The Clothes in the Wardrobe
programme.desc: Waris Hussein talks about his memories of directing Martin Shermans adaptation of Alice Thomas Ellis novel, The Clothes in the Wardrobe. He reflects on being starstruck at getting to work with Jeanne Moreau, and talks about having to find last minute locations in Egypt when those originally chosen looked like a Pinewood set with a palm tree

programme.title: Screen Two
programme.desc: Margaret would rather become a nun than a housewife, but the wedding is arranged and the guests have begun to arrive. Drama, starring Julie Walters. First broadcast 17 January, 1993

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Crime and Punishment: The Story of Corporal Punishment
programme.desc: Documentary examining the use of physically imposed discipline, and how attitudes toward its application have changed over the years. The film investigates the ways schools, religion and the justice system have been involved with corporal punishment, and how its imposition has also provoked debate from a sexual aspect

programme.title: Tornado: The 100mph Steam Engine

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: After years of sacrifice to care for his mother, Ralphs living room doubled as his bedroom, leaving him ashamed to host friends. Mark Wright, Maxine Dwyer and Tommy Walsh work their magic on the property, with Maxine expertly cleaning and decluttering and Tommy designing a stylish media wall. Together, they give Ralph his living room and bedroom back, restoring both function and pride into his home

programme.title: Robson Greens Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson travels to the south of the Lake District to meet his friend Helen Skelton, who gets a surprise when the actor takes her on a walk among wolves in their natural habitat, after which they relax with a meditation session. Back on his own, Robson heads to a disused quarry for an unforgettable scuba diving experience

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young couple want to swap their London flat for something bigger in the East Midlands, where Nicki Chapman opens the front doors to a selection of homes with charming gardens. Nicki cant miss the opportunity to meet another young couple whove already made their escape to develop a luxury leather goods business

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.sub-title: Big Buddhas and Tiny Tea Pots
programme.desc: James Broad sets out to raise as much money as possible for a woman diagnosed with Alzheimers, sorting through Chinese collectibles, many of which came from her husbands relatives, delicate porcelain, rugs and paintings. Meanwhile, Lauren Wood finds that restoring a table is no easy task

programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Lauren Laverne present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon offers Phil an olive branch after an awkward encounter, while Vicki and Zoe have an altogether more violent encounter in the Square. Howie gets a job delivering parcels, and Cindy is impressed by the initiative of Jasmine, a girl applying for a job at the Albert

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: A Couple of Eggs Short of an Omelette
programme.desc: Zachs 17th birthday proves a nostalgic time for Stacey as she remembers she was the same age when she became his mum. Its also bake-off time for Stacey and Joe as they compete to come up with best lemon drizzles for the occasion. Joe hops on a plane to see his mum in Andalusia, while back home, Stacey plots her latest animal takeover of the garden

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The classroom drama returns for a new term. Headteacher Stella is forced to navigate a fresh set of challenges when her estranged grandchildren land at the school. New teacher Darius Donovan (played by comedian Jon Richardson) is soon shaking things up in the staffroom, while Jack Rimmer finds himself tackling the troubles of a new generation as he returns as school counsellor. Schuey and Agnes cause uproar when they rebel against Stellas new rules

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Donte is plunged into crippling debt, so Ashton takes drastic measures to pull his dad out of this latest crisis. Stella and grandson Ben clash as the school welcomes a cohort of year six students and Debs is excited to step into Wendys shoes for the day, but Nicky is forced to step in when things get out of hand. Jack tries to help Libby settle back into school life when she clashes with Aleena

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The recent flare-up causes suspicion and speculation among the remaining honeymooners - and even some of the strongest couples start to feel the strain of stranded life. At the Couples Cove Masquerade Ball, the arrival of an unexpected guest sends shockwaves through the group. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: SAS: Catching the Criminals
programme.desc: Billy Billingham goes on the hunt for secret illegal tobacco hides with some help from a pack of sniffer dogs

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph wants to solve the mystery of a house in Corby, Dion Dublin seeks enlightenment in a north Wales property and Martin Roberts meets a driving instructor and his wife who are determined to transform a Derby bungalow

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley hosts the latest contest from Exeter, where antiques experts Ben Cooper and Kate Bliss help two teams of contestants pick out three items to sell at auction. Items considered include a Georgian-style silver serving dish and arts and crafts copper candlesticks. Caroline also heads to Box, near Bath, to visit the UKs only tennis ball manufacturer, where she learns about the origins of the tennis ball and how it gets its all-important bounce. Then everyone heads to auction, where Tim Weeks presides in Wiltshire

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Single mother Krisztina receives help decluttering her home. The team sorts through a huge toy collection and a shed full of clutter turns out to have lots of untapped potential

programme.title: Robson Greens Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Former Strictly dancer Janette Manrara meets up with Robson Green in County Durham as they seek out things to do in north east England to relax, recharge and reset. The pair take to a lake in kayaks to reconnect with a blue space before being led through a guided meditation by a former soldier. When they reach Robsons digs for the night, Robson and Janette are given a dance lesson from a couple who made their name on Strictlys forerunner, Come Dancing

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Having been to the Lake District over 50 times, todays couple have decided to stop visiting and start living in one of the UKs most spectacular national parks. The about-to-be-retired couple need Steve Browns help to find them, and their two rescue cats, a new forever home in the Cumbrian countryside

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Nigel and Laura need help decluttering after moving into their dream cottage by the sea, the smaller space has left them overwhelmed with belongings and theyre hoping to raise money to fly their daughter home from Japan to visit them

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show where three couples face a series of 50/50 questions which hurtle down the Answer Run towards them. Across three rounds, the couples build up their cash pots, but only one pair can face the Final Run and earn the opportunity to take home their cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Angela Rippon co-host the quiz in which contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. Subjects include US states and female crimefighters

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones present the magazine show, with celebrity guests and stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian tries to convince Sharon that Zoe is lying. Stacey tells Lily that Sean has invited them to live with him in Brazil. Penny orders Peter to tell Lauren the truth about his mystery woman. Jasmine makes a good impression with Cindy, but its clear Elaine isnt a fan

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The finalists travel to Athens, Greece, where they are set three challenges designed to broaden their culinary horizons like never before. For starters, they prepare a lunch for locals, including a selection of dishes chosen by TV chef Agiro Barbarigou. Day two sees the amateurs working in the kitchen of Michelin-starred restaurant Patio, mentored by executive chef Panagiotis Giakalis, then finally they are made solely responsible for service at a VIP dinner at the Akti restaurant, cooking for Agiro, Panagiotis and more of Athens leading chefs

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The honeymooners are elated when boats bring their friends and family from the other side of the world, ready to give their opinions on their new partners And while double dates deliver some home truths, one couple decide to wave goodbye to their stranded dream for ever. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Girl Fight
programme.desc: Chloe Crozier heads to Durham for the toughest fight of her amateur career and a shot at turning professional. Rachel McIlhagga faces her toughest kickboxing fight so far against an opponent who is sure to put her confidence to the test. But if she wants to progress back into the MMA cage, this is a fight she must win. Back home in Ballymena, Niamh McNeill and mum Julie appear on the same card - before Niamh heads off to start a new life in Australia

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Former UFC fighter Elwood Dalton is determined to put his life of violence in the ring behind him but times are tough and he struggles to make ends meet - until bar owner Frankie makes him a proposition. She needs a head bouncer to protect her Florida Keys bar from a criminal and his rabble-rousing associates. It seems easy enough - until he comes up against a psychotic gun-for-hire determined to pummel him into submission. Remake of the 1989 Patrick Swayze thriller, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Daniela Melchior and Conor McGregor

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: DI Bones investigates a Victorian traffic accident, Roman scientist Pliny the Elder suffers a stupid death in ancient Pompeii and the history of Australia is revealed

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Brian the handsome scientist reveals the wonders of the Greek universe and fast-talking pensioner Bob Hale tries to explain the space race between America and the USSR

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Reliant Robin to investigate the reasons behind the lack of three-wheeled cars on the market. The Stig takes the Bentley Continental Supersports for a spin around the test track, and James May fires up the Toyota Hilux for a final challenge - a gruelling drive up Eyjafjallajokull, an active Icelandic volcano that halted flights in British airspace in 2010

programme.title: Red Eye
programme.desc: A hotel manager overcomes her fear of flying and boards a busy late-night flight to Miami, seating herself next to the seemingly friendly man she met in the airport. However, once the plane leaves the ground, she discovers her fellow passenger is a terrorist intent on involving her in an assassination plot. Wes Cravens suspense thriller, starring Rachel McAdams, Cillian Murphy and Brian Cox

programme.title: Get Out
programme.desc: After African American photographer Chris and his white girlfriend Rose visit her wealthy parents, he suspects theres more to the locals than meets the eye. Oscar-winning psychological thriller written and directed by Jordan Peele (Us), starring Daniel Kaluuya, Allison Williams, Bradley Whitford and Caleb Landry Jones

programme.title: Charlie Coopers Myth Country
programme.desc: The writer and actor tours the UK in his campervan, exploring local legends, myths and folklore and gathering evidence in a bid to get to the truth. He begins by going in search of Black Shuck, the demon dog of East Anglia, attempting an overnight stakeout to capture it on film, with unexpected consequences

programme.title: Charlie Coopers Myth Country
programme.desc: The writer and actor heads to Wiltshire, home to ancient sites such as Stonehenge, Avebury and the Westbury chalk horse, to get to the bottom of why humans feel the need to leave marks on the landscape. He turns his investigation towards the far more recent phenomenon of crop circles, hoping to settle a debate that has plagued his family for years. They think that crop circles are the work of aliens, but Charlie strongly doubts that belief

programme.title: Angels of the North
programme.desc: Professional boxer Ewans fighting career hits a stumbling block, while Shane makes a big error with Carmens name plate. Over at the salon Sammyjos workload takes its toll and Molly proves she has been underestimated by her fellow Longlox girls

programme.title: Angels of the North
programme.sub-title: A Lot Can Happen in Two Months
programme.desc: With Jade off sick, Shane is stretched at Pure Ink - and he ends up missing a detail. In Jarrow, Ewan and the boys are focused on the future, while at Longlox theres a major makeover and Sammyjos life changes in a big way

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Reliant Robin to investigate the reasons behind the lack of three-wheeled cars on the market. The Stig takes the Bentley Continental Supersports for a spin around the test track, and James May fires up the Toyota Hilux for a final challenge - a gruelling drive up Eyjafjallajokull, an active Icelandic volcano that halted flights in British airspace in 2010

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Brothers, flatmates and polar opposites Samir and Nikhil find themselves on an adventure when they accidentally steal a package from their maniac neighbour. Short, one-off comedy, starring Karan Gill, Ikky Kabir, Eshaan Akbar, Elina Saleh, Ed Kear and Andrea Valls

programme.title: Ibiza: Secrets of the Party Island
programme.desc: Zara McDermott meets Spains top lawyer when it comes to defending drug traffickers, Ricardo Alvarez-Ossorio, and joins the Spanish Civil Guard as they tackle organised crime and drug trafficking across the country. While on a night shift with an ambulance crew, Zara speaks to a nurse who explains how Ibiza is the ideal testing ground for new drugs

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Characters from history perform songs of tales of their lives, including Alexander the Great, Joan of Arc, Charles Dickens and Rosa Parks

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: King Henry VIII goes on a TV dating show, notorious femme fatale Queen Cleopatra tries to find love online, Emperor Nero stars in his own horrible romance movie, and Victoria and Albert sing about how they found love at first sight

programme.title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams
programme.sub-title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams: Ultimate Test
programme.desc: When numbers dwindle in Manchester, Presley and the boys are forced to go on a recruitment drive in order to save their team, but Freddie faces a losing battle fundraising the money to restore the club to its former glory. In Blackpool, after the team building day, the girls team play their first match against a prestigious boarding school. Freddie questions the teams commitment when only a few boys turn up to training in Liverpool

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: A Couple of Eggs Short of an Omelette
programme.desc: Zachs 17th birthday proves a nostalgic time for Stacey as she remembers she was the same age when she became his mum. Its also bake-off time for Stacey and Joe as they compete to come up with best lemon drizzles for the occasion. Joe hops on a plane to see his mum in Andalusia, while back home, Stacey plots her latest animal takeover of the garden

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The classroom drama returns for a new term. Headteacher Stella is forced to navigate a fresh set of challenges when her estranged grandchildren land at the school. New teacher Darius Donovan (played by comedian Jon Richardson) is soon shaking things up in the staffroom, while Jack Rimmer finds himself tackling the troubles of a new generation as he returns as school counsellor. Schuey and Agnes cause uproar when they rebel against Stellas new rules

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Donte is plunged into crippling debt, so Ashton takes drastic measures to pull his dad out of this latest crisis. Stella and grandson Ben clash as the school welcomes a cohort of year six students and Debs is excited to step into Wendys shoes for the day, but Nicky is forced to step in when things get out of hand. Jack tries to help Libby settle back into school life when she clashes with Aleena

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Comedy, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, following one mans quest for attention from anyone wholl give it to him. After splitting up with Guy, Jamma is now between jobs and sleeping on Winnies sofa. However, when he unexpectedly sees Guy for the first time in six months at Isaacs pop-up art exhibition, the spark between the exes is undeniable. To Jamma and Guys surprise a handsome stranger takes a special interest in their relationship status. With Russell Tovey

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guys double-booked himself, so asks Jamma to house-sit and let a builder in. Jamma finds Guys manuscript about exes, but on discovering hes not included is sent into a spiral. Isaac comes over to calm Jamma down, but the pair discover Saif pampering himself in the house. Farida arrives with divorce papers and a new showbiz career to show off about. Sitcom, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan and Russell Tovey

programme.title: Ibiza: Secrets of the Party Island
programme.desc: Zara McDermott delves into the dark economy that keeps the drugs flowing in Ibiza, meeting with the drug supplier who never deals on the streets but feeds a seemingly never-ending supply of Class A drugs to demanding clientele all over the island. She also speaks to the police officers on the front line who are trying to cope with the excessive drug use, often allowing users with small supplies to walk away in order to target the dealers in the act of selling. Officers explain how social media has made their jobs much more difficult and Zara follows as they raid a luxury car rental company next to the main airport

programme.title: Ibiza: Secrets of the Party Island
programme.desc: Zara McDermott meets Spains top lawyer when it comes to defending drug traffickers, Ricardo Alvarez-Ossorio, and joins the Spanish Civil Guard as they tackle organised crime and drug trafficking across the country. programme.title: The Fast and the Farmer-ish
programme.desc: Northern Irelands Bogmen and Determinators rev up against each other, tackling extreme racing, reversing and mowing challenges to grab a place in the semi-final. Farmer and YouTuber Tom Pemberton hosts as the teams go head to head in three high-octane agricultural challenges

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Journalist Tir Dhondy investigates the disappearance of Sarm Heslop, who went missing from a luxury Caribbean charter yacht in 2021. Tire retraces Sarms last known movements and tracks down two boat captains whose vessels were moored near the yacht she vanished from. Also, she gets to question Ryan Banes, Sarms boyfriend, account of what happened what happened through his lawyer David Cattie

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir Dhondy meets with island police and is given CCTV footage that has never been released, showing Sarms last known movements with her boyfriend, Ryan Bane

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir Dhondy searches for the yacht Sarm vanished from, and tracks down Ryan Banes ex-wife, hearing first-hand about her experiences while married to him

programme.title: Aneeshwar and Lizzie Go Wild

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Newfoundland Sylvie is a big therapy dog with big soft cuddles who loves to help people when theyre worried. She and her owner Katrina visit all sorts of people every day, young and old. Sylvie and Katrina are visiting some schoolchildren on their very first day at school. Sylvie knows the children will be feeling nervous and excited all at once. She helps the children find the classroom with a big blue pencil on its door, and then she and Katrina help the children do a relay race around an obstacle course in the school hall. The children are nervous, so Sylvie offers to go first. But when one little girl, Navinda, is scared of the big bear, Sylvie has to use her superheart to be be calmer and friendlier than ever before.

programme.title: The Donald Trump Show
programme.desc: A novel take on the US presidents second term in office, recutting archive news clips as drama to retell Trumps story. The second episode focuses on President Trump as he pursues an ambitious agenda to transform America. Hes learned his lessons from his first term and seems not to be allowing anyone or anything to get in his way, breaking with the democratic norms the country was founded on. As he takes on the media, the press and the universities while ensuring that he keeps US borders secure, Trumps sends the National Guard to Los Angeles and Washington DC

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.sub-title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes: Season by Season
programme.desc: Springtime is a time of new life - its a time where the Dales and the Lakes flourish. In Grasmere, sheep farmers Peter and Robert Bland are marking up their new lambs, before setting them and their mothers free on the open fell. On the Castle Bolton Estate in the Dales, head gamekeeper Ian Sleightholm and his children offer a hand to licenced bird ringer David Baines, as they capture and ring chicks no longer so common across the country. Because of Ians management of the moor, species such as the lapwing, curlew and merlin have found a haven. In Wensleydale, a private woodland has become a sanctuary for another rare British breed - the red squirrel

Claire and Mark, meanwhile, have moved back from Australia to be close to where Claire grew up. Trumps loose strategy keeps everyone guessing - with no one knowing what will happen

These shadow scholars help students in countries like the UK secure degrees and launch careers, all without doing the work themselves

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Joe Lycett is joined by Alan Davies to sample an action-packed weekend in Trieste, northern Italy. Trieste is famous for the Bora, the north-easterly wind said to shape the city and its inhabitants. Joe and Alan discover this at the Wind Museum, where curator Rino presides over a collection of wind samples donated from all over the world. A few miles north the pair enjoy a food and fizz pairing in the village of Prosecco. Fortunately, theyre in the right place for hangovers as Trieste is Italys caffeine capital. No mini break is complete without learning a new skill to brag about when you get home, so Joe and Alan attend a painting class

He liked his five-minute commute to work and believed that Kirstie could formulate a plan to transform their home. In one of the most turbulent builds ever, did Kirstie pull it out of the bag?

programme.title: Michael Palin in Venezuela

programme.title: The Body
programme.desc: The detective work that solved the case of 15-year-old Karen Price, whose skeletal remains were found bundled up in an off-cut of carpet by Cardiff builders in 1989 - eight years after she had last officially been seen. This programmes looks at the methods investigating officers used to piece together a jigsaw of forensic information which would aid in jailing the men responsible for Karens death

programme.title: 999: Killer on the Line
programme.desc: A look at murders that were callously planned and premeditated, with 999 calls reporting the crime as an accident. The first programme examines the case of pub landlord Stephen French, who murdered a customer at the Wisbech Arms, Cambridgeshire

programme.title: Murdered at First Sight
programme.desc: Exploring the murder case of 18-year-old Kelsey Smith, who disappeared after visiting a Target store in Overland Park, Kansas. programme.title: Meal Deals: Which One Is Best?

The owner previously ran a successful catering company but has struggled to adapt her skills to meet the demands of a new business - and with a years worth of food stored in the freezer Gordon realises he has a tough job ahead

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Another pair of singles walk down the aisle, but could a frosty first impression leave one bride out in the cold on her wedding night? And as the honeymoons continue, one couples romance goes from strength to strength

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns wins a professional basketball team in a poker game at the annual billionaires retreat. He decides to build a state-of-the-art stadium in an effort to lure fans, but the proposed site is on the last remaining bee colony in Springfield - prompting Lisa to lead a protest

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa lets her imagination run wild when she makes a new friend and they create a magical kingdom together called Equalia, complete with characters and plotlines. But they find themselves facing a nightmare when the boundaries between reality and fantasy become blurred. With the voice of Emily Blunt

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Stuart hosts a Halloween party at the comic-book store, and Howard talks incessantly about his work on board the International Space Station, annoying his wife and friends. Penny and Leonard have a steamy encounter at the lab. Guest starring real-life astronaut Buzz Aldrin

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon upsets guest star Stephen Hawking when they play an online game of Words with Friends, until Howard advises him to let the scientist win. Elsewhere, Penny enrols in a college class, but decides to keep it a secret from Leonard. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire finally gets Phil to agree to sell their old car, Mitchell decides to build a large princess castle for Lily, and Manny invites a girl over for a study date - which makes Gloria uncomfortable. American comedy following the lives of three dysfunctional households - a man who struggles to keep up with his younger wife, an embarrassing husband and a gay couple getting used to parenthood after adopting a Vietnamese baby. Starring Julie Bowen and Ty Burrell

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire finds herself becoming an overbearing mother when she finds out that Alex has a crush on a boy, and Haleys idea of sisterly advice is not helping matters. Meanwhile, Mitchell and Cameron have an argument over the formers aversion to public displays of affection, and Gloria believes that her grandmother has been visiting in her dreams. Comedy, starring Ed ONeill

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends compete in a scavenger hunt designed by Raj to test their scientific knowledge and life skills, but the game brings out the best and worst in everyone. As the hunt progresses, Howard and Amy begin to bond over their shared musical tastes, while Penny and Sheldon work together as a team and Bernadette becomes fiercely competitive

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon introduces Amy to Raiders of the Lost Ark - one of his favourite films - and is distraught when she ends up pointing out a plot hole that ruins the whole story. Meanwhile, Leonard realises he can manipulate Penny into feeling sorry for him when his mother publishes a reveal-all book about his childhood problems. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon re-evaluates the time he spends with Amy when she takes a job at the university. Meanwhile, Howard is forced to sleep on his friends sofa after he gets into an argument with Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Mayim Bialik

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon stumbles upon a major scientific breakthrough, causing him to feel like a fraud, while Penny steps up her game with Leonard after seeing Howard make a romantic gesture to Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The squad members head to the annual Tri-State Cop-Con event, which is usually their excuse for a big party. However, their fun is threatened when Captain Holt asks them to be on their best behaviour.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Amy vanishes shortly before she is due to take her sergeants exam, leaving Jake and Rosa with just a few hours to find her and bring her back to sit the test before it is too late. US cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Melissa Furnero

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is forced to eat bland food after he burns his taste buds while trying to copy a fire-eating street performer. He becomes a regular at Springfield Elementarys canteen where he learns a new parenting technique to try out on Bart and Lisa - but its overbearing nature leads to disaster. Meanwhile, Marge enjoys a sauna she discovers in the basement

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge and Homer rent an apartment in an affluent area so their children can have a good education when Springfield Elementary is rated the worst school in the state. Bart wastes no time in establishing a bad-boy persona, and increases Lisas popularity by telling people she knows a pop star. With the voice of Elliot Page (Juno)

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Another pair of singles walk down the aisle, but could a frosty first impression leave one bride out in the cold on her wedding night? And as the honeymoons continue, one couples romance goes from strength to strength

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets fired from the movie, prompting her to take a serious look at her life. Raj receives advice from Sheldon after he sees Emily on a date with another man at the cinema, while Howards mother breaks her leg. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon becomes upset about his career, the destruction of the comic-book store and Leonard and Pennys future living arrangements. Elsewhere, Howard is unable to keep hold of a carer for his mother. Comedy, staring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Its a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Marge
programme.desc: Otto marries his girlfriend Becky, but in true rock n roll fashion the marriage is over as soon as it has begun, so big-hearted Bart invites her to stay with the family. However, a paranoid Marge thinks she is trying to steal Homer away from her. Featuring the guest voice of Parker Posey

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Spoof behind-the-scenes special exploring what makes the dysfunctional familys antics so popular. Featuring the guest voices of Willie Nelson, Gary Coleman and Stephen Hawking

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Tonys case suffers a shocking blow, Clare celebrates when Donny delivers some news, and two residents find comfort in one another

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family go for a holiday at the seaside, where Homer is unwittingly tempted by a British femme fatale. With the guest voice of Olivia Colman

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Fred and the staff serve an extra portion of romance for Valentines Day and for guests like Brendan who has been on around a thousand dates, it might just be their special night. After an arranged marriage at a young age 42 year-old Annie has been out of the dating game for a long time, will 50 year-old Dave be the man of her dreams? 27 year-old clubbing queen Amanda is fed up of men being too keen too soon, shes hoping club rep Ryan will be different. Special effects make-up artist Erin is looking for a partner to look beyond her disability and see the person she really is

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Two more pairs of singles take the leap of faith, and while theres an instant spark for one couple, another brides horseback arrival sends her new in-laws reeling

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics voice their opinions on shows including Made in Chelsea, Dragons Den, Line of Duty, Louis Theroux: Shooting Joe Exotic, The Invisible Man and The Graham Norton Show. Plus, they share their observations on news reports concerning beer and the coronavirus. First shown in April 2021

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Pink-jacket-rocking Taiwo is first into the restaurant, for a date with fellow content creator Hemah. Hemahs opening gambit is to tell Taiwo to choose her drink, and he spends the rest of the date trying to keep up. Enthusiastic adventure swimmer Lindsey is paired with Sicilian chef Stefano, while party-loving DJ Bear is matched with matched with keen-to-get-married nanny Hollie

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Two more pairs of singles take the leap of faith, and while theres an instant spark for one couple, another brides horseback arrival sends her new in-laws reeling

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on TV programmes from March, 2021, including Line of Duty, The Great Celebrity Bake Off for SU2C, The Flight Attendant, Teen First Dates, The Circle, Remarkable Places to Eat, This Morning featuring Matt Hancock, and the News on the Suez Canal

programme.title: Below Deck
programme.desc: Bens careless mistake leaves the guests and crew stranded on a remote beach at night in the middle of a storm. and a new deckhand has many of the crew swooning

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer accidentally kills a legendary alligator while on holiday in Florida, so he and the family go on the run to escape the terrible punishment they are convinced awaits them, adopting new identities and taking jobs in a cafe. Featuring the guest voice of Kid Rock

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Amy are forced to take an unexpected road trip to Arizona to pick up Sheldon after his epic railway journey ends in chaos. Meanwhile, Howard finds Stuarts relationship with his mother strange, and Penny has an interview for a sales job at Bernadettes workplace. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: All the Kings Men
programme.desc: A small-town senator wins popular support by railing against the corruption of the political establishment and vowing to defend the interests of ordinary working people. However, once in office, he succumbs to greed as readily as those he once so virulently condemned. Political drama, starring Broderick Crawford, Joanne Dru, John Ireland and Mercedes McCambridge

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: A couple whose daughter was born deaf and mute decide to enrol her in a special class in the hope that she might learn to speak. The difficulties they face in raising their child expose the tensions within their marriage. Drama based on the novel The Day Is Ours by Hilda Lewis, starring Phyllis Calvert, Jack Hawkins, Mandy Miller and Terence Morgan

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: A world-weary man embarks on a unique odyssey of self-discovery, attempting to reach home by diving into and swimming in the neighbourhood pools along his route. Director Frank Perrys cult drama, starring Burt Lancaster, Kim Hunter and Janice Rule

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog
programme.desc: A prominent Victorian gentleman thinks he has got away with poisoning his wife, but his shrewd maid knows the sordid truth and uses it to blackmail him. As the killers social standing improves, he realises he has to get rid of the scheming servant once and for all, but his plans to dispose of her lead him into even more danger. Period thriller, with Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons and Bill Travers

programme.title: Cowboys and Aliens
programme.desc: A Wild-West town dominated by a cattle baron comes under attack by invaders from another world. It falls to a mysterious stranger with no memory to unite the townsfolk, a gang of outlaws and an Apache tribe, in a bid to fight back against the aliens, and learn the truth about his own past. Sci-fi Western, with Daniel Craig, Harrison Ford, Olivia Wilde and Sam Rockwell

programme.title: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande
programme.desc: A retired school teacher whose husband has recently died longs to experience the passion that was missing in her marriage. She resolves to get a crash course in pleasure by hiring a charming young sex worker. Comedy drama, starring Emma Thompson and Daryl McCormack

programme.title: Fresh
programme.desc: Noa, a young woman from Portland, Oregon, is fed up with online dating, but a chance meeting with Steve in a supermarket leads to romance. After being invited to his luxury home, Noa discovers her new boyfriend has some unusual appetites. Comedy horror, starring Daisy Edgar-Jones, Sebastian Stan and Jonica T Gibbs

programme.title: The Riot Club
programme.desc: Two first year students at Oxford join an infamous drinking society for the Universitys privileged social elite. When they attend an annual dinner at a local pub, the new arrivals are shocked by how far their friends take their hedonistic lifestyle and contempt for others. Thriller drama based on Laura Wades stage play Posh, starring Sam Claflin, Max Irons and Natalie Dormer

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: A farmer in need of money agrees to guard a notorious outlaw until the train arrives to transport him to jail. Meanwhile, the pair are holed up in a hotel, where his prisoner plays mind games with him - and the villains cohorts are waiting outside ready to engineer an escape. Western adapted from a novel by Elmore Leonard, with Van Heflin, Glenn Ford, Felicia Farr and Leora Dana

programme.title: The Man from Colorado
programme.desc: An American Civil War veteran, twisted by his experiences during the conflict, becomes the judge of a small town. He embarks on a reign of terror, ruthlessly misusing his power, and it falls to an old friend from his army days to bring him down. Western, starring Glenn Ford, William Holden, Ellen Drew and Ray Collins

programme.title: Film4 Interview Specials
programme.desc: Stars Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the franchise

programme.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
programme.desc: The penniless grandson of a duke plots to eliminate the eight relatives standing between him and a vast inheritance. He shoots, drowns, poisons and explodes his way through his family tree, but his final triumph is ruined when his lady loves husband kills himself. Ealing black comedy, starring Alec Guinness as all eight potential victims, with Dennis Price, Valerie Hobson and Joan Greenwood

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: A party of explorers studying the sunken remains of the famous liner meets an elderly woman who was a passenger on the ill-fated maiden voyage. She recounts how she boarded the ship while on the brink of being forced into marriage by her family, and was stopped from killing herself by a penniless artist. She fell in love with her saviour, but the disaster on the horizon meant their time together was doomed to be short. James Camerons Oscar-winning romantic drama, starring Kate Winslet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Billy Zane, Kathy Bates and Bill Paxton

programme.title: The Contractor
programme.desc: After being involuntarily discharged from the Marines, a man joins a paramilitary organisation to support his family in the only way he knows how. Drama, starring Chris Pine, Ben Foster, Gillian Jacobs and Kiefer Sutherland

programme.title: How to Blow Up a Pipeline
programme.desc: A crew of environmental activists plots a daring plan to disrupt an oil pipeline. Director Daniel Goldhabers crime thriller, starring Ariela Barer, Jordan Sjol and Lukas Gage

programme.title: Woman at War
programme.desc: An Icelandic environmental activist single-handedly fights a campaign of illegal sabotage against the aluminium industry. Her priorities shift when her application to adopt a Ukrainian orphan is accepted, leaving her struggling to balance the future of the Earth with the immediate needs of her child. Comedy drama, starring Halldora Geirharðsdottir and Johann Sigurðarson. In Icelandic, English, Ukrainian, Chinese and Spanish

programme.desc: A wealthy Texan hires four mercenaries to rescue his wife, who has been abducted and taken to Mexico by a bandit gang. Western adventure, with Burt Lancaster, Lee Marvin, Robert Ryan, Woody Strode, Jack Palance and Claudia Cardinale

programme.desc: Two special forces agents are given the task of transporting a pair of female convicts to prison, only to come under attack by a mercenary force sent to kill them. When they discover the true identity of the women in their charge, they realise the situation is even more dangerous than it seems. Action adventure, starring Steven Seagal and Steve Austin

programme.desc: A cop quits the force after being betrayed and nearly killed by his corrupt partner, and starts a new life in New Mexico as bodyguard to the daughter of a wealthy businessman. German prosecutors recently confirmed that Christian Brueckner, the man theyve long believed responsible, is set to be released from prison with no charges imminent in relation to Madeleines abduction and suspected murder. Criminologist Dr Graham Hill, a former senior Met detective who was in Portugal during the early stages of the investigation, returns to Praia da Luz. Medical drama starring Natalie Anderson, Robert Daws and Wendy Craig

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass attempts to organise Aidensfields car rally - an event guaranteed not to pass without incident. Amid all the preparations, an elderly man is attacked, while Gina finds true love at last. Rural drama, starring Tricia Penrose and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A film crew descends on Aidensfield, filling the vain villagers heads with thoughts of stardom. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard, Jason Durr and Gareth Thomas

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Everyone is anxious at the arrival of Matthew Crawley, the heir presumptive, but he soon encounters problems settling into his new life in Downton, and his mother Isobel immediately crosses swords with Violet. Meanwhile, butler Carson is mortified to be confronted with his past, and housemaid Gwen seems to have a secret correspondent. Costume drama, starring Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville, Dan Stevens, Penelope Wilton, Elizabeth McGovern, Jim Carter and Rose Leslie

programme.desc: Maggie gets the all-clear from the doctor and decides she will return to Bude, forcing PC Penhale to take desperate measures to persuade her to stay in Portwenn. Ruth uncovers a raft of family heirlooms while clearing out a barn at the farm, and the mounting tension between Martin and Louisa peaks when she discovers he has booked a date for James Henrys christening without consulting her

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Bellamys childhood sweetheart returns to Aidensfield for her mothers funeral and uncovers a dark family secret in the attic, leading to a traumatic encounter with her unbalanced sister. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A feuding farmers wartime past has explosive consequences, while Greengrass, always eager to make a quick profit, tries to cash in on a prediction for the future of his sidekick David. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called in when David Kenworthy, the son of a prominent local family, is found murdered on the beach at Whitley Bay. A witness spotted arcade owner Larry Crowe arguing with David on the night of the killing, and a search of the suspects property uncovers a bloodied baseball bat. However, Larry has a cast-iron alibi and its clear he wasnt the only person the victim met that night. A second death then leaves Vera facing mounting pressure to crack the case, and struggling to answer the question of why David was drawn to the seafront on the evening of his fathers retirement. Brenda Blethyn stars in the murder mystery, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of a man killed by a single gunshot wound is discovered on the moors and a burnt-out truck containing the remains of a deer is found a mile away. Joe is convinced the case is a poaching war gone wrong, but for Vera, the truth is never that straightforward. Delving into the victims story, she unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Following the recent death of his grandfather, he returned to Northumberland after a 15-year absence to sell his inheritance to a wealthy couple - but pulled out of the deal at the last minute. Could his death be linked to a dispute over land? Brenda Blethyn and David Leon star in the murder mystery

programme.title: Nolly
programme.desc: To save her career, Noele returns to the stage in one of theatres hardest roles, and must overcome her insecurities to prove her doubters wrong. Helena Bonham Carter stars as the former soap actress, with cameos from original Crossroads actors Susan Hanson and Tony Adams

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: After enjoying a trip to the theatre with Captain Hastings, the detective is disturbed by the sound of gunshots in an apartment at Whitehaven Mansions, and soon finds himself investigating a murder. Drama, starring David Suchet, Hugh Fraser and Philip Jackson

programme.desc: Coras attempts at matchmaking are dashed when Mary is smitten not by intended target Evelyn Napier, but by his handsome friend, Turkish attache Kemal Pamuk. The couples mutual attraction sparks a train of events whose consequences ripple through the entire household. Gwen is humiliated as her secret ambition is exposed, and Bates takes extreme action to cure his limp. Costume drama, starring Maggie Smith, Michelle Dockery, Brendan Patricks, Theo James, Rose Leslie and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.desc: Bert struggles to come up with the money to repay loan sharks Alastair and Norman Tonken, who gave him £1,000 to clear his debts. Eleanor falls ill and Martin diagnoses a strangulated hernia, but when the ambulance goes to the wrong village, he has no alternative but to perform the emergency operation himself in his surgery. With Martin Clunes, Ian McNeice and Louise Jameson

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Charlotte Church guest stars as a girl who strikes up an unlikely friendship with David while struggling to cope with the effects of her parents messy divorce. Rural drama, with David Lonsdale, Derek Fowlds and Philip Franks

Rural drama, starring Jason Durr, Bill Maynard, William Simons and Trevor Peacock

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the mysterious death of businessman John Shearwood, found floating in the water under the Gateshead Millennium Bridge when he was supposed to be on a golfing trip to Ireland. The mans wife Stella and brother Luke are baffled to discover he was working as an informant for HM Revenue and Customs. Chief Revenue investigator Owen Preece (guest star Robert Glenister) reveals Johns business manager Mark Donovan has been running an alcohol scam through their haulage firm and the deceased had agreed to offer information in exchange for immunity from prosecution. Was his cover blown? Owen doesnt think so, and Mark has an alibi - unlike Johns wife. Brenda Blethyn stars, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope is called to a quiet country lane where a young man has been found dead following a collision with a car, but it becomes clear on closer inspection it was not an accident and is more complicated than just a hit-and-run. Vera discovers the victim is a popular market trader and heads down to his pitch to start to put together an idea of who he was and why anyone would want him dead. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: When a spine is dredged out of Whitney Marsh, a new case begins for Jess and Sunnys team at Bishop Street CID with four potential suspects. Crime drama, starring Sanjeev Bhaskar and Sinead Keenan

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Trish calls on the help of her friends as she tries to bring light into the interior of her dark medieval property. For Bart and Sarah, it is decision time as they visit a château

programme.title: Chateau DIY

Near Cognac, at Château de Brives, wedding season has begun for Sarah and George. While Sarah shows off her new floristry skills George has the important role of MC

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four sets of campsite proprietors battle it out to be named best value, with the competition beginning at Ambers Bell Tent Camping in Mannington, Norfolk, a retro-styled pre-erected campsite where artistic host Amber Wykes challenges her guests to go native with a series of bushcraft trials. Over dinner, guests Derek and Julies opinions on glamping irritate both Amber, and glampsite owners Nick and Sheila. Then back at the tents, brother-and-sister team Russell and Jane arent too impressed with the sleeping arrangements. In the morning, the self-catering breakfast leads to complaints aimed squarely at Amber

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second day of the competition is at Park Farm Camping and Caravan Site in Norfolk, where husband and wife team Derek and Julie Nice are proud to show off their budget, family-friendly site. Former marksman Derek treats his guests to a spot of clay pigeon shooting, bringing out his competitive side

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to 500-year-old Layer Marney Tower in Essex for the third day of the competition, where they are welcomed into luxury glamping lodges by Nick and Sheila Charrington. The guests have little to complain about with the accommodation, but a revelation over dinner changes how they see things. Plus, a treasure hunt organised by the hosts sends one team on a wild goose chase

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Day four is at the Foxhunter Park in Kent, where brother and sister Jane Stacey and Russell Saunders own a caravan site that includes a bistro and entertainment. The accommodation is luxurious but the large scale of the site does not sit well with the campers - and the evening entertainment of a fire-eating limbo dancer leaves most of them cold

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The campers meet for the final time to find out what they thought one anothers stay was worth. Amber is offended by Dereks low scoring, while he is thrown by Nick and Sheilas feedback. Russell and Jane have an axe to grind with Derek whose low scoring of their park is made worse by what they see as a personal attack on their hosting, while Nick and Sheila appear to emerge relatively unscathed

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw travel to Rochdale to collect a unique family heirloom: a 1953 Riley RMF. A now-rare, British post-war classic has been handed down from father to son for 70 years. Current owner Richard has been unable to get the Riley up and running, so the boys try to make an automotive dream come true. But theres more to this restoration than meets the eye

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw travel to Oxfordshire to collect a 1973 Porsche 911 Targa. The run-down car belongs to Ben, whos had the motor for around 35 years. However, due to life getting in the way, and developing early onset dementia, he has been unable to get the car running. Wife Jeannetta and friend Andy hope that Car S.O.S can breathe new life into this old classic

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two sets of discerning house-hunters, each with very strong ideas on what they wanted. The searches may have been tough - in some instances they didnt even make it inside some of the properties - but both have faced even more challenging times since. In 2012, couple Robin and Colin wanted to move outside of London, but only an architectural gem was going to do. In 2014, Lia and Andrew said they were done renting in Londons popular Isle of Dogs, and wanted to buy their own home now they were starting a family

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Northern Ireland where Jennifer has hit a wall climbing the property ladder after selling her semi-detached starter home in Belfast and Tony and Val are looking to relocate from London to County Down

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Matt and Sophie White from Sussex as they build a giant family house of fun for themselves and their children. Going against the norm of designing a serious and practical home, the couples property features a revolving bookcase door, secret dens, hiding places and a firemans pole. Matt uses a steel frame system to allow them to change the layout of the property, and other changes include amending the window shapes and sizes, and adding a half floor to create a James Bond room

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: The staff at Kings College Hospital treat patients on Valentines Day, including a 53-year-old psychologist who has injured his shoulder in a motorcycle accident. His partner is abroad and he doesnt want to worry her, so he decides to keep the incident a secret. Also in the AandE department are a man with a bleed on the brain and an elderly widower who has been bitten by his dog

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE

Worried mum Nikki puts on a brave face while doctors perform tests, but dad Scott is stuck hundreds of miles away in Scotland. Meanwhile, Anne and Holton - part of a security team dealing with more than 50 incidents a month - encounter a variety of challenging patients on the night shift at Kings College Hospital in London

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

Paramedics suspect the barking cough of a toddler is the classic sign of croup, and an intoxicated man with a deep gash to his head needs stitches but first, they need to wrestle a bottle of alcohol from his grasp

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Château Lagorce, Edward must learn to roof tile for a poolside project. Ben and Vanessa start transforming an old laundry into a cinema and games room

programme.title: Four in a Bed

A Segway race helps whip up the guests competitive spirit, Donna gets emotional when her work-life balance is questioned, and chef David proves he can handle the unexpected at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Accusations fly around the table as payments are revealed and the winner announced. Swallows Rest is first up and hosts Jane and Keith want to find out about Rays colour preferences. Next Darren and James of the Burley Inn quiz Ray over his fussiness around their pine furniture. programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head to a barn in Somerset where a run-down Jeep Grand Cherokee is stored. programme.title: Car S.O.S.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit successful buyers from seasons past. In 2017 mother and daughter Linda and Laura bought a flat in Bristol with Phils help that would suit Laura and her partner until they found their own home and Linda would move in with her husband when they retired. In 2018 Ranald and Marjorie were looking for a bigger home to hold family get-togethers with enough bedrooms for all the grandkids. programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Edinburgh helping house-hunters who want to be in the capitals most popular enclaves. Phil is with James and Lesley, who is living with ME, or Chronic Fatigue Syndrome, which has affected their search. Lesleys condition impacts what they need in a property and also how often theyve been able to go out to viewings, so Phil shows them various options that suit their future-proofing requirements

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets architectural designer Dan and interior designer Nina, who want to build a sleek, unique family house. Instead, they plan to make it central to their design, turning the pond into a biodiverse waterscape, and then floating their house above it. Its a challenge for anyone - but to save money, Dan is doing it largely himself, despite his limited experience with new builds

Sonic and Shadow must put aside their differences and work together to repair the temporal damage and outwit diabolical scientist Dr Eggman (Brian Drummond)

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: The wise-cracking blue hedgehog, made famous by a series of popular video games on Sega consoles, continues his computer-animated adventures through the Shatterverse. At the end of the first series, the eponymous spiny mammal (voiced by Deven Mack) learnt from black hedgehog Shadow (Ian Hanlin) that the original version of Green Hill no longer exists. Sonic is trapped in a multiverse of mayhem with different iterations of his friends Amy Rose (Shannon Chan-Kent), Knuckles (Adam Nurada), Rouge (Kazumi Evans) and Tails (Ashleigh Ball). Sonic and Shadow must put aside their differences and work together to repair the temporal damage and outwit diabolical scientist Dr Eggman (Brian Drummond)

programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. programme.title: How to Cook Well in Morocco
programme.desc: Rory OConnell arrives in the Moroccan city of Chefchaouen on market day, where traders line the narrow streets. At the Tissemial Restaurant, the chef learns how to make beef meatball tagine and then meets a local guide to learn more about the citys history. Chef Said Rahma shows Rory how bissara, a traditional soup made with fava beans, is made at the Bab Sour Restaurant

programme.title: Nevens Ulster Food Tour
programme.desc: Neven Maguire visits Glenarm Castle in Ballymena where he wanders around the gardens with estate manager Adrian Morrow, and also sees their famous shorthorn beef cows. He also takes a trip to Morellis ice cream shop in Portrush, where he samples some of their award winning flavours. Nevens own recipe is vanilla and hazelnut no-churn ice cream with poached pears and chocolate sauce

programme.title: RTÉ News: Nine OClock and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news

programme.title: RTÉ Investigates
programme.desc: Reporter Joe Galvin investigates whether cotton collected from forced labour is being circulated in Irelands clothing supply chains. He follows the threads back to Chinas Xinjiang province, where a repressed minority pick and process cotton to make many of the clothes worn by Western consumers

programme.title: The Great House Revival
programme.desc: Hugh Wallace meets teacher Grace Cotter and her landscape gardener husband John. They are restoring what they think is a modest Georgian farmhouse in the hills of Kilmacsimon for them and their soon to be three children in West Cork. John does most of the work himself, and when hes not working for his own business, he spends every spare moment at the house

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: DI Humphrey Goodman and fiancee Martha Lloyd settle in Devon, where she runs a restaurant, while he joins the local police. Humphrey and Esther join the Shipton Abbott Players for a murder mystery rehearsal. Though Humphrey is only playing a detective, things turn from amateur to professional when the actor playing the victim is found dead with a real knife in his back. As the duo tackle the perplexing crime, they soon unravel a dark past that reveals hidden connections between the actors. Away from the case, Humphrey and Martha embark on the process of becoming foster parents, while Anne catapults herself into the world of online dating. Detective drama, starring Kris Marshall, Sally Bretton and Zahra Ahmadi

programme.title: Impact: Anatomy of a Car Crash
programme.desc: In December 2016, joy and tragedy collided on Military Road outside Dungarvan, County Waterford. One car carried a Cork family on their way to see Santa at Winterval and the other carried three young men, whose lives would be extinguished in an instant. This documentary revisits one of the most devastating road collisions in Irish history, laying bare the enduring physical, emotional and psychological scars left in its wake

programme.title: The Hills Are Alive: A Year at Kylemore Abbey
programme.desc: This edition takes gives viewers a chance to see the popular estate on seasonal holidays. As Christmas approaches, the kitchen team conducts a tasting test among Kylemores staff for its seasonal foodie treats. In the New Year, the community mourns the loss of its beloved former Abbess, Mother Maire. The nuns celebrate Easter with traditions dating back to St Benedict, St Patrick and Jesus

programme.title: Son of a Critch
programme.desc: A bittersweet coming-of-age comedy set in 1980s Newfoundland based on Canadian comedian and actor Mark Critchs memoir of the same title. The pint-sized hero is 11-year-old Mark, who grows up in St Johns with his radio reporter father Mike, mother Mary, older brother Mike Jr and grandfather Patrick. Mark nervously prepares to enter junior high school and he makes a new best friend, Ritche Perez.

programme.title: Kayak o Thuaidh
programme.desc: Novice kayakers Tessa Fleming and Irial Ó Ceallaigh nervously prepare to take on one of Irelands most daunting and precarious sea crossings. A short passage to the inner islands off the coast of Machaire Rabhartaigh looks easy compared to the unrelenting, rolling waves to Tory island. They find out about the Gaelic culture of the island and following a disrupted sleep and another treacherous Atlantic crossing they are relieved to arrive back on the mainland. In Irish

programme.title: Na Feilte Tine
programme.desc: In the second part of the series that explores the four indigenous Irish festivals - Samhain, Imbolg, Bealtaine and Lúnasa - the focus is on Imbolg - St Brigids Day. Celebrated on the first of February, Imbolg originated as a Celtic fertility festival but now signals the beginning of spring and an end to the darkness of winter

programme.title: The Traitors Ireland Uncloaked
programme.desc: Host Kevin McGahern, along with celebrity guests and players from the show, assess the latest betrayals, mind games and manipulations

programme.title: Life and Death Row
programme.desc: The documentary follows the final few weeks of the appeals process in Texas as Ramiro Gonzales desperately tries to have his execution overturned, while the family of his victims seek justice. In 2006, Ramiro Gonzales received the death penalty for kidnapping, raping and murdering a former classmate, 18-year-old Bridget Townsend, but in his appeals process, his supporters argue that the human brain only matures by a persons mid-twenties and he has now become a man of deep religious faith

programme.title: The Traitors Ireland Uncloaked
programme.desc: Host Kevin McGahern, along with celebrity guests and players from the show, assess the latest betrayals, mind games and manipulations

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden purchases two dilapidated apartments nestled in the sun-kissed hills of rural Sicily, intending to raise them from their ruins and create luxury holiday homes. The hope is that she and workmate friend Alan Carr to make a huge profit they can donate to charity. After arriving at the crumbling property for the first time, the piles of rubbish and abandoned junk suggest to both that that this visit will be no holiday

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr take on their first project - designing a Sicilian kitchen. Kicking off the demolition in 36-degree heat proves to be a trial for Alan, and he soon realises that taking on a build in a medieval hilltop town comes with its own unique challenges. With the help of Project Manager Scott, Amanda barters with the locals at a nearby marble factory as she bags a bargain for their feature island and brushes up on her culinary skills in Marsala, learning how to cook Sicilys signature dish

programme.title: First Dates Hotel
programme.desc: Six-foot gym owner and ex-military man Richard is paired with Emilia. Despite his muscular appearance, he is a sensitive soul who loves musicals and Harry Potter, and his Aspergers leaves him unable to read what others are thinking, so mid-date he is forced to ask Emilia how he is doing. Meanwhile, 40-year-old hotelier Andy arrives at Vesuvius for his first ever date with a man, 37-year-old bouncer Joseph, and police officer Angie hooks up with car salesman Tom, who is determined to leave his stereotypical lad image behind

programme.title: Songs of Ireland
programme.desc: Pat Shortt and Mike Hanrahan conclude their journey around Ireland. The duo start in the town of Keady in Armagh, where they perform Four Green Fields with Ciara ONeill. Pat and Mike move on to County Down to perform The Star of the County Down with singer-songwriter Sarah McCreedy. In Belfasts County Antrim, they meet Winnie Ama and come up with a fresh take on Ill Tell Me Ma

programme.title: Home Rescue: The Big Fix
programme.desc: Dee Coleman and Peter Finn come to the aid of Ger and Josephine Nihill, who live In the rural heartland of Tulla in County Clare with son Johnny and daughter Bridget. Josephine is a full-time carer for both her husband and daughter but the house is full of clutter, from curtains, clothes and chairs to more than a dozen mattresses. Can the team turn things around in time for eldest daughter Marys wedding?

programme.title: Raised by the Village
programme.desc: Fifteen-year-old Alex from north Dublin has been skiving school, and her volatile behaviour is a source of stress for her widowed mother Elaine. Sixteen-year-old Calum from Jobstown in Tallaght has dropped out of school with no plan for his future. A dose of hard work and community connection at the Fitzgerald familys Marlhill Open Farm may be what this teen needs to find a new passion for life

programme.title: Ranger Hamzas Eco Quest
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers discover how Scots pine trees play an important role in the environment. They find out that they can help improve habitats for plants and animals and that their rough bark is a great place for insects to hide from predators. They learn that wood from these trees can be used to build homes and furniture and that wood ants can use its pine needles to make their homes too. On the way, they spot a red squirrel out looking for seeds to eat.

programme.title: Boardwalk Empire

Meanwhile, Angela worries about how her clandestine affair will affect her future, Chalkys suspicions are aroused by a mysterious visitor, and Lucy makes a desperate bid for Nuckys affections. Prohibition-era drama, starring Steve Buscemi, Kelly Macdonald and Michael Pitt

programme.title: Boardwalk Empire
programme.desc: Nucky heads for the Republican Party convention in Chicago, where he tries to influence plans for the presidential election - and crosses paths with Jimmy once more. Prohibition-era drama, starring Steve Buscemi and Michael Pitt

Drama, starring Steve Buscemi, Michael Pitt and Kelly Macdonald

Fantasy drama, starring Emilia Clarke and Liam Cunningham
